direction.raw_text: . RESEARCH LABORATORY - NIGHT 1 An attractive FEMALE SCIENTIST in a gore-spattered lab coat moves fearfully along a wall, passing benches strewn with broken lab equipment. Her ample bosom heaves as she
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: TS nervously, mascara-rimmed eyes darting to and fro. Glass SMASHES on the floor nearby and MELODRAMATIC MUSIC swells. The woman backs into a shadow, not noticing a pair of dead eyes catching the moonlight behind her. The music climbs to a frenzy as something GROANS horribly into the woman's ear. She spins around on her stiletto heels as a rotted face looms out of the darkness, drooling through broken teeth, and lunges at her neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brains!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON the woman as she raises her hands and SCREAMS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BABCOCK'S HOUSE, LIVING ROOM - NIGHT Eleven year-old NORMAN BABCOCK sits on the floor watching TV. He has large piercing eyes and a messy shock of hair. The movie scene we just witnessed continues off- screen with the sound of bloodcurdling SCREAMS. Behind him sitting upon a sofa is GRANDMA BABCOCK, a plump old lady squinting through thick glasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's happening now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The zombie is eating her head, Grandma.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not very nice. What's he doing that for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because he's a zombie. That's what they do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well he's going to ruin his dinner. I'm sure if they just bothered to sit down and talk it through it'd be a different story. Norman CHUCKLES, as if the idea is absurd, then winces as he hears his father shout from the kitchen. ParaNorman 2.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PERRY BABCOCK (O.S.) Norman! Didn't I tell you to take out the garbage?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coming, Dad!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell him to turn up the thermostat too, will ya? My feet are like ice. Norman nods to her and shuffles over to the kitchen door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BABCOCK'S HOUSE, KITCHEN - CONTINUOUS Norman's mother, SANDRA BABCOCK, is emptying the dishwasher. She is in her late thirties, and wears `mom' clothes that do no favors for her figure. His father,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is older, with a neatly-trimmed beard trying hard to delineate chin from neck. He stands on a chair, decked out in tool belt and safety goggles, even though he's only changing a light bulb in a ceiling fixture. Sandra smiles at her son as he makes his way silently to an overstuffed trash can as tall as he is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi. Whatcha watching in there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sex and violence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. That's nice. Perry glares over as Norman wrestles with the garbage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't you be like other kids your age and pitch a tent in the yard, or have a healthy interest in carpentry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perry...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you said kids my age were too busy shoplifting and joyriding?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norman! He hefts the bag onto the floor and ties it in a knot. ParaNorman 3.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Breezing into the kitchen through the back door while
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: inanely on her cell phone, Norman's older sister
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is fifteen years-old and is the bleached-blonde cheerleader archetype of every schoolboy's sordid dreams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yeah, he's r-i-double p-e-d. Like, a seven pack at least. (TO NORMAN) Ew! Watch it! She pushes her brother out of the way as he drags the garbage outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Courtney, be nice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, she totally doesn't deserve him. I mean, she's nice and I really like her, but she's a complete loser. Yeah, I know. Courtney slumps into a chair at the table, twisting a strand of gum out of her mouth with a finger. Norman returns inside and shuts the door, pausing a moment as if thinking something over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad? Grandma says, "Can you turn up the heating?" Her feet are cold. The bubble Courtney is blowing POPS against her face, Perry rolls his eyes and GROANS, and Sandra pales.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, Perry...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many times do we have to go through this, Son? Your grandmother is dead!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then why do you keep on talking to her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because she talks back!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: you are such a liar! ParaNorman 4.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not making this up! I swear! She talks to me all the time!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yeah? Prove it! Norman levels her a look that says "you asked for this".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She said it's not very ladylike to hide photos of the High School quarterback with his shirt off in your underwear drawer. Sandra and Perry raise their eyebrows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew it! You've been sneaking around in my personal stuff!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No I haven't! Grandma told me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are the worst! Courtney, brimming with outrage, storms out of the kitchen, her ponytail wagging furiously behind her. Sandra kneels down beside Norman with a wearily sympathetic smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norman, I know you and Grandma were very close, but we all have to move on. Grandma's in a better place now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No she's not, she's in the living room. Perry throws his arms in the air, swaying on the chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your grandmother was old and sick, and she died. That's all there is to it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perry, this is just part of the mourning process. ParaNorman 5.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop indulging him! I'm nothing if I'm not liberal, but that limp- wristed, hippie garbage needs to be nipped in the bud! Norman SIGHS and steps between his parents as they argue. He mutely heads out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BABCOCK'S HOUSE, FRONT YARD - CONTINUOUS The argument in the kitchen continues, slightly muted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) This behavior might be okay with your side of the family, but I'm not putting up with it anymore! Not me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Oh, not this again!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: UP to find a light go on in Norman's bedroom window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BABCOCK'S HOUSE, NORMAN'S BEDROOM - NIGHT Norman sits on his bed, using a couple of zombie action figures to act out his parents' ongoing "discussion" which carries upstairs. Norman gets up off the bed and approaches the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This isn't the West Coast, Sandra; people talk! They do!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) He's just sensitive, Perry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Oh please, "sensitive" is writing poetry and being lousy at team sports... not this! I won't have him turn out like that uncle of yours! If that crazy old tramp has been around here putting ideas in Norman's head...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Perry, no one's had anything to do with Uncle Prenderghast in years! I bet he doesn't even know what Norman looks like! Norman quietly closes the door, and the room goes black. ParaNorman 6.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MR PRENDERGHAST'S HOUSE, STUDY - NIGHT 6 CLOSE ON a faded photograph of Norman, held in the grimy hand of MR PRENDERGHAST. He stands over a dusty desk scattered with pictures of Norman, Sandra and older family members. He is in a dark study; a wall-to-wall trove of curious miscellanea and dumpster-dived junk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not much time, not much time... He pulls an old leather-bound book out from the mess, and traces a finger over a woodcut illustration on its cover; an ethereal woman lying beneath a cluster of stars. Wincing with pain, the man drops the book and clutches at his chest, COUGHING and GASPING horribly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S to a wall covered in countless photographs, newspaper clippings and scrawled occult markings. It is a shrine of sorts; a madman's recondite genealogy project, and at its center is a photograph of Norman, posing with his family on vacation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: IN to the photograph, hurtling past the Babcocks and through dense trees further and further into a dark forest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: INT. BABCOCK'S HOUSE, NORMAN'S BEDROOM - MORNING Norman opens bleary eyes, turns off his zombie hand alarm clock, and slides out of bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BABCOCK'S HOUSE, LIVING ROOM - MORNING 8 Dressed for school, Norman pauses at the front door and turns to look at the sofa in the living room. He waves happily, and Grandma smiles back. Courtney passes him as she comes down the stairs in the opposite direction. She also stops to look at the sofa, but to her eyes it is empty. She sneers contemptuously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SUBURBAN STREET - MORNING Norman ambles past houses and lawns spotted with small- town America detritus; cheap plastic lawn furniture, peeling-paint fences and cookie-cutter topiary. Here the quaint colonial buildings are mostly in disrepair, their picket fences rotten or daubed in graffiti. ParaNorman 7.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norman is watched dubiously by the occasional passer-by as he shouts amiable greetings to people who simply aren't there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good morning! Hey Bruce! How's it goin'? Not much. I'm kind of late for school. I need to go. Hi, nice to see you guys. Good morning. Sorry I gotta run. Excuse me. Pardon me. See ya. At one street corner, Norman bends over a gutter. He is watched curiously by a man retrieving his morning paper across the other side of the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Norman crouches over the flattened remains of raccoon road kill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey there little buddy! C'mere! He realizes he is being stared at and slowly turns to face the onlooker, then hurries away. Though no one else sees them, to Norman's eyes, a whole host of ghosts are meandering through the streets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, good to see you! How you doin'? Hi Mrs Hardman. You look nice today. I like what you've done with your hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does anyone smell burning?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, peace, man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Totally.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As you were, soldier.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, yes sir!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yo Norman, you playin' hookie?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No no, I'm just late for school. Sorry, I gotta go. (to Mobster Ghost) How you doin'? ParaNorman 8.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, how you doin'? A little further along Norman nods pleasantly to the ghost of a parachutist impaled in the branches of a roadside tree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi! How's it hanging?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ho ho! Haven't heard that one before. Well, it's a nice day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MAIN STREET - MORNING Its industrial days now rusted behind it, Blithe Hollow has become a run-down tourist town, celebrating its heritage with lame fetes and crass knick-knacks. A massive billboard beside the main square reads "BLITHE HOLLOW - A GREAT PLACE TO HANG!" illustrated by a group of waving Puritans beside an equally cheerful witch hanging from a gallows. Across the street a huge banner suggests this year is particularly important for the town; "BLITHE HOLLOW - 300 BEWITCHIN' YEARS!" The town center is lacking in charm; its historical buildings subsumed into a vulgar modern thoroughfare with gaudy witch-themed shop fronts and cracked sidewalks. Everywhere Norman walks, the witch theme is prevalent. Cars have bumper stickers that extol such witticisms as
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . There's a dingy bar, the BAR GENTO, and a greeting card store called BEST WITCHES. Norman hurries past SHERIFF HOOPER, a heavyset black woman, and DEPUTY DWAYNE, lanky and awkward and looking like he'd rather be elsewhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watch and learn. "Parking violation" is my middle name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? I thought it was Rhona. They glance up disdainfully as Norman passes by. Clearly in this town Norman has something of a bad reputation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCHOOL ENTRANCE - MORNING 12 Norman walks up a tree lined path that leads to a squat school building. Out front, the name "BLITHE HOLLOW MIDDLE SCHOOL" is carved into an ugly hunk of granite. ParaNorman 9.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: SCHOOL KIDS line the path in front of Norman; a gauntlet of jeering, merciless, pre-pubescent horror. Norman takes a deep breath as he begins his daily walk of ridicule. Most of the kids give him a wide berth, but others sneer and WHISPER as he passes. A bell RINGS the start of the school day, and everyone makes a bee-line for the building. Someone barges Norman with their shoulder, knocking his backpack to the ground. Other kids SNICKER as they step over him. As the last of them head through the lobby doors, Norman is left alone on the path. Norman bends down to retrieve his spilled possessions, and a dark shape beyond the gate catches his eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Mr Prenderghast, barely visible as he stands within the shadow of a tree, stares back at him. Norman frowns and squints his eyes, but now sees only trees and shadows, so he continues up the steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCHOOL HALLWAY, LOCKERS - MORNING An expanse of unevenly lacquered floor, scuffed by scores of dragged heels. Rows of dented lockers line the walls. Norman stands before his locker, across which someone has daubed the word "FREAK" in marker. Clearly something of a daily ritual, he reaches inside, takes out a bottle of surface cleaner and a rag and proceeds to wipe it off. Across the hallway, another kid is removing graffiti from his locker. NEIL is overweight with frizzy red hair, and is busily rubbing a handkerchief over the word "FATTY". He watches Norman with interest. A voice behind his shoulder gives Norman a start.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, ghost jerk! You know what? Norman turns to find textbook bully ALVIN, the only 6th grader in his class who shaves, looming over him. He is flanked by a couple of leering sycophants, one of whom wears a T-shirt emblazoned with "TEAM ALVIN". Norman SIGHS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want, Alvin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you see some more ghosts, goober? ParaNorman 10.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The kids LAUGH uproariously, encouraging Alvin to show off some more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! Hey! Norman! Alvin points to a fly that has landed on the locker beside him. He swats it flat with his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Talk to that. The kids around Alvin burst into LAUGHTER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is so Alvin! The bullies strut away, content in the psychological damage they've managed to inflict.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Loser!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was good, right guys? Norman mutters as they leave, but not loud enough so as anyone might hear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Flies don't talk. Across the hall, Neil continues to watch with sympathy, but he is already being hurried along by his friend
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a nerdy Indian kid with braces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neil, come on. Let's go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCHOOL GYMNASIUM - DAY Amidst stacked bleachers, foam mats and stray dodge balls, a crudely constructed stage fills one end of the gymnasium. Mediocre art class scenery represents a colonial town, complete with plywood hills, chapel and crescent moon dangling perilously from a basketball hoop. In a director's chair far too small for the job is MRS HENSCHER, an imposing woman with spectacles and beret who looks like she smells of too-much perfume. At the front of the stage wearing a pilgrim hat and carrying a large scroll, is NORMAN. He is surrounded by kids whose attempts at home made period costume leave a lot to be desired. ParaNorman 11.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You stink of illiteracy! (A BEAT) Pilgrims? The Mayflower? Don't any of you know anything about the history of this town? Mrs Henscher tries her best to remain unfazed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Puritans were strict and devout settlers, who came here to build a home, a place without sin. What is it now Salma? Salma is holding her hand up. She looks like the Wicked Witch of the West. Even beneath green makeup and plastic warty nose, it is clear she is not best pleased.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why is the witch always a hideous old crone with a pointy hat and a broomstick? I don't believe it's historically accurate, Mrs Henscher! Mrs Henscher's knuckles clench white around her script. She attempts an understanding smile, in the same way a shark might.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not supposed to be. It's supposed to sell postcards and key chains. (CLAPS HANDS) So let's try it again. Top of page six, Norman. Norman skips ahead on his scroll.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The founding fathers of Blithe Hollow discovered an evil witch amongst them...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No no, Norman, with gusto! Like this! Waving her arms theatrically, she bellows Norman's lines, milking every syllable for effect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They put her on trial and hanged her! (MORE) ParaNorman 12.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MRS HENSCHER (CONT'D) But the vengeful witch cursed her accusers, seven of them in all, to die a horrible and gruesome death, and rise from their graves as the living dead; their souls doomed to an eternity of damnation! (A BEAT) Now I want you to try that again, but with conviction! My reputation is at stake here, and I won't have this turn out like that wretched Kabuki debacle of oh-nine! As she launches into her lecture, Norman notices a change in the room. The lights dim, the wind outside picks up, and indistinct shapes flicker at the corners of his eyes. Norman glances around at the other kids on the stage, to see if they are seeing what he is seeing. For a split second the children are replaced with faded figures in real Puritan dress. Seven solemn figures. As he turns around nervously, Norman sees the suggestion of another place fizzing in and out of the shadows...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norman! Are you listening to me, boy? Norman is brought back to the real world with a start, and nods timidly from behind his scroll.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, Mrs Henscher.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So am I. Now, unless there's any other issues, let us resume... They put her on trial and hanged her! Neil turns excitedly to Norman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ooh! This is my moment! He shuffles toward Salma and swings his branch around, not realizing Alvin has slung the hangman's noose around Norman's neck. Norman is yanked off balance and staggers into Neil who keels over, rigid branch arms unable to stop his fall. He lands on top of Salma, her kicking legs sticking out from under him as though Dorothy's house had just landed on stage. The kids break into uncontrollable LAUGHTER. ParaNorman 13.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boom, baby!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry! Mrs Henscher flings her script into the air, her face beet red.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, you useless bunch of... The school bell RINGS drowning out her howling voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCHOOL HALLWAY, LOCKERS - LATER As kids hotfoot it out of the building as quickly as possible, Norman stands pitiably in front of his locker. Fresh graffiti reads "SEE YOU TOMORROW, FREAK". Norman heads for the door, and pretends not to hear when Neil shouts out behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norman, wait up!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MAIN STREET - LATER Norman keeps going, but Neil quickly catches up, beaming intently at the side of his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I keep telling you, Neil. I like to be alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So do I. Let's do it together! You shouldn't let them get you down. They always do stuff like that to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I'm fat. And my allergies make my eyes leak. And I sweat when I walk too fast. And I have a lunchbox with a kitten on it. And I have Irritable Bowel Syndrome. I guess there's a whole bunch of stuff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doesn't it bother you? ParaNorman 14.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nah. You can't stop bullying, it's part of human nature. If you were bigger and more stupid, you'd probably be a bully too. It's called "survival of the thickest".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . URBAN STREET - DAY Norman and Neil walk away from the school along a tree lined street at the end of which stands a huge commemorative statue. It is a grotesque effigy of the evil witch from the local legend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Psssst! The boys stop. It seems to be coming from the witch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That statue just "pissst" at us! Wild-eyed Mr Prenderghast suddenly leaps in front of them, startling them as he staggers closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know who I am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The weird stinky old bum who lives up the hill?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (points to Norman) I was asking him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. I know. I was told not to talk to you. Sorry. Mr Prenderghast steps in front of Neil, leaning closer to Norman and whispering conspiratorially.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you know why you're not supposed to talk to me? Norman tries to back away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can see ghosts too! And I know that's not all you've been seeing lately, is it? Bad omens? Things you can't quite explain? Strange faces peering through the veil? Norman's eyes widen further. ParaNorman 15.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MR PRENDERGHAST (CONT'D) And I'll bet no one told you about the witch's curse, did they?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually, we're learning about it in school..?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a tree! Mr Prenderghast impatiently turns his back on Neil and leans close to Norman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's something you really need to know! This is the most important thing you will ever hear! The fate of everyone depends on it! Now listen close... The witch's curse is real, and you're the one who has to stop it! Mr Prenderghast grabs Norman's arm and leans closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've gotta use your gift of talking to the dead! He breaks into a HACKING COUGH, face turning beet red and bloodshot eyes bulging.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because if you don't the witch's ghost... (COUGHING) And this is the most important thing of all... You have to go up to the old graveyard and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Leave him alone! An apple bounces off Mr Prenderghast's head. He turns to find Neil standing behind them on the path, lunchbox open in his hand providing leftover low-carb ammunition.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't make me throw this hummus! It's spicy! Mr Prenderghast thinks better of it and turns to flee the scene. He HISSES out of the side of his mouth at Norman. ParaNorman 16.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This ain't done with! You'll see it soon enough! Watch for the sign! As he hobbles away, Neil peers down the street after the old man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeez, what a dirty old creep!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's my uncle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So is it true?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Norman just stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you see ghosts? Like, everywhere? All the time?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, yeah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Awesome! Do you think you can see my dog Bub? He was run over by an animal rescue van. Tragic and ironic. We buried him in the yard. Could you see him? Norman frowns disbelievingly, completely taken aback.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sweet! Come on!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NEIL'S DRIVEWAY Neil forcibly drags Norman up the front driveway of a pastel-painted house. A pair of legs spotted in oil stick out from beneath a pimped-up camper van. Neil's brother MITCH calls out from under the van.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neil? That you? ParaNorman 17.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Mitch! We're gonna go play with the dead dog in the garden and we're not even gonna have to dig him up first! Mitch sits up. He's a strapping six-foot jock with tattooed biceps. The kind of guy who wears year-round flip-flops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd you say? Mitch pulls his brother aside so as to exclude Norman, who stands awkwardly a little way away, surrounded by cheery lawn ornaments and ineptly manicured topiary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neil, isn't he that weird kid? Y'know, "Look at me, I talk to ghosts so people will pay attention to me." Mitch makes a goofy face and twitches farcically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you stop doing that? It's kinda stupid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now listen to me, you don't need to be hanging out with weird people. That's a tip. Neil scowls at his brother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't blow this for me, Mitch. This one's not weird. He talks to dead people. Neil has had enough and defiantly walks away from his brother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NEIL'S GARDEN - LATER Neil rummages around in the bushes of his back yard, surrounded by a gloriously tasteless menagerie of lawn ornaments. Norman stands slightly to one side surveying the rows of plastic gnomes and wondering if he should have gone straight home after all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's around here somewhere... (A BEAT) So does everyone come back as a ghost? ParaNorman 18.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norman hesitates. This level of interest is new to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. My grandma told me it's usually people who still have stuff to figure out. Or sometimes it's the ones who died suddenly, or in a bad way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and Norman turns to see a translucent puppy wagging its tail cheerfully, despite being chopped neatly into two halves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bub?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he there? How's he look? Bub BARKS, then his front half notices his tail and runs behind to sniff his own backside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh... good. Bub bounds over to Neil, runs clean through his chubby calves, then doubles back for another try.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's happy to see you.

result.heading: BLITHE HOLLOW MIDDLE SCHOOL DRAMA SOCIETY

SCHOOL - NIGHT 29 Lit by spotlights, a large banner over the entrance reads, "THE WITCH'S CURSE - presented by BLITHE HOLLOW MIDDLE SCHOOL DRAMA SOCIETY - written, produced and directed for the stage by Margot Henscher". A notice beneath it reads "SPELLING BEE - NEXT WENSDAY". A chorus of kids' voices can be heard SINGING from inside, belting out an operatic rendition of Donovan's "Season of the Witch".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCHOOL GYMNASIUM - SAME Rows of plastic chairs in front of the spotlit stage are occupied by expectant families. Among the sea of faintly buzzing video cameras, and a ripple of APPLAUSE, Sandra politely smiles at the acting talents of other peoples' children. Next to her, Perry struggles to fit a battery into his camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great, now we'll never get to remember this moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Salma, in full witch get-up, waves her hands theatrically at the other children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I curse you accusers to die a horrible and gruesome death and rise from your graves as the living dead; your souls doomed to an eternity of damnation! The Pilgrims who aren't dying and rising from the dead begin to menace Salma with their farming implements, and begin a slow ominous chant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kill the witch! Kill the witch! Sandra nudges her husband and cheerily points toward the stage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gosh, aren't they adorable? Norman hears a HOOTING sound from above. An owl with big glowing eyes wheels down over the audience from the beams of the gymnasium. Norman glances around, wondering why no one else seems to notice as it glides low and alights in the papier mache branches on Neil's head. It turns to Norman and HOOTS. ParaNorman 22.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks down from it and catches Neil's eye. Neil makes a puzzled expression.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kill the witch! Kill the witch! The chanting seems to deepen and slur and the air grows dark and thick. The shapes of the audience and the kids beside him swim around, blurring like a finger pulled through oil paint. The ceiling disintegrates into clouds, which CRACKLE with lightning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (under his breath) Oh no! Not again! All around trees have sprouted out of nowhere, and through the darkness in the distance are occasional lights of small houses. This might be how this very spot looked three centuries ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . OLD FOREST - NIGHT As Norman turns on the spot GASPING, he hears a RUSTLE in the bushes behind him and spots several dark and ominous figures in Pilgrim clothing scouring the undergrowth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Witch! We know you're out there! Norman stands on a twig which, naturally, CRACKS loudly, and the figure turns around and points at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Witch. More figures emerge from out of the darkness, wielding hayforks. They SHOUT threateningly and, as one man, surge toward him. Norman turns and runs. The trees around him are shifting, but there's no wind blowing the branches. Limbs GROAN as they twist, bearing down on him like ragged talons trying to stop his escape. Soon he can run no further, the way ahead tangled up into a wall of thorny fingers. ParaNorman 23.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norman finds himself pushed up against the trunk of a huge tree, and a knothole grimaces at him, wood splitting open into a hag-like mouth. It furrows a mossy brow and speaks in a low rumbling voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dead are coming! Norman GASPS and tries to push himself away, but the pursuing figures are drawing closer, and there's no escape. A familiar voice whispers out of nowhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Hey buddy! Are you okay? Norman turns around to find the knothole is now Neil's face, bulging out of the side of the tree with a look of concern. This is the last straw, and Norman SCREAMS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCHOOL GYMNASIUM - NIGHT Norman stands next to Neil on stage, eyes closed and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Everyone around him stares in stunned silence as, still SCREAMING, he runs into the spotlight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! He continues running directly off the edge of the stage and lands on the floor with a THUMP. For a moment no one knows quite how to react. Mrs Henscher quizzically checks her script. Norman's eyes focus and he sees everyone standing around him, staring. Sandra pushes through the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norman!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did he say the dead are coming?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no, no!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Everyone jumps as Norman abruptly sits up, eyes wild.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The tree told me! ParaNorman 24.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perry's face drains of color while the other parents
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and MUTTER, crowd speak for "what a weirdo". Norman sees their expressions of disgust and suspicion. Worst of all, peering around parents' legs with a look of shock and fear is Neil. Norman catches his eye a moment, and Neil looks down at the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . STATION WAGON - LATER Barely keeping his fury in check, Perry drives home, Norman sitting despondently in the back seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is where it stops! It's one thing being a mental case in front of your family, but not the whole freaking town! There's not gonna be any more talking to ghosts, or grandmas, or, or... what is it now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think it's trees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're grounded! You hear me? Perry pulls the car up in the Babcock's drive and gruffly climbs out of the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is ridiculous. I wish everyone could see what I see! I didn't ask to be born this way! Perry mutters as he slams his door shut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Funny, neither did we. Norman catches the remark and feels it hard in his gut. His mother hears it too, and leans over her seat with a look of sympathy. A beat as she sees the pain in her son's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Y'know, sometimes people say things that seem mean, but they do it because they're afraid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's my dad. He shouldn't be afraid of me. ParaNorman 25.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sandra's eyes are filled with sorrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not afraid of you. He's afraid for you. Sadly, Norman climbs out of the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCHOOL - AFTERNOON Ominous clouds roll long shadows over the school building. Norman stands at the bottom of the school steps, trying to prepare himself for what he knows is going to be a bad day. He steels himself, and SIGHS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCHOOL HALLWAY - MORNING Norman walks the familiar gauntlet of school kids, only this time the abuse is tenfold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look! It's AbNorman!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd the tree tell you today, Norman?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are the dead coming soon, Norman?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An overhead bulb casts a dim light over chipped wall tiles and yellowed ceramic sinks with leaky faucets. The door opens and Norman hurries inside, a number of voices still SHOUTING behind him. He shuts the door, cutting them off, and leans against it, taking a breath. He heads over to the first stall. The door is locked, so he takes the next one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON Alvin, sitting on the toilet in the next stall scribbling obscenities on the wall to pass the time. He pauses as he hears the lid drop next door, then resumes his vandalism. Norman sits on the lid of the toilet, pulling his knees up under his chin feeling sorry for himself. ParaNorman 26.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ANGLE ON toilet paper in an industrial-sized roll. It jitters on its mount and begins to turn slowly on its own, unspooling sheet by sheet toward the floor. Norman frowns and watches as it stops unravelling and a draught of wind blows out of nowhere, ruffling his hair. The toilet roll suddenly spins violently, flinging the paper into the air in reams. The screws holding the dispenser to the wall RATTLE fiercely. The toilet underneath Norman begins to shake and shudder, spilling water over the floor. Norman WAILS loudly as he jumps onto the back of the cistern. Alvin is frozen in place in his stall, hearing the noises and really not sure how to react to them. He glances down and sees toilet water leaking across the tiles. He quickly pulls up his pants to cover his dignity, and jumps up off the toilet with a SQUEAL. In Norman's stall everything stops dead and the lid of the toilet slowly CREAKS open. Norman GASPS as Mr Prenderghast's face stares up at him out of the toilet bowl. With some effort the old man's ghost shimmies out of the toilet, eventually POPPING out like a cork from a bottle, hovering in the air in front of Norman's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You died?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but I got unfinished business here!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ew! Couldn't you use another stall?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My ghost isn't going anywhere until I pass on my duty to another! And that would be you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me? No, you must have it wrong!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh it's you all right! I've been holding back the witch's curse for years, but now I'm dead. It has to be you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I... I don't know what any of it means! ParaNorman 27.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before Norman's eyes the bathroom stall and everything beyond it is ripped away, revealing thick undergrowth and tall trees. Norman is suddenly sat on the toilet in the middle of a forest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It means the past is coming back to haunt you! Time is running out! The anniversary of the witch's death is tonight. Her ghost is going to wake up, and when she does she'll raise the dead! You gotta keep her in her grave! The toilet paper on the ground twists up beneath Norman's feet, sculpting skull faces and clutching hands that reach for him as he shrinks back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I'm just a kid! How am I supposed to stop it? In an instant the air and trees around him are eaten away, the school bathroom reappearing through the holes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Read from the book at the spot the witch was buried!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What book?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The one in my hands! Norman looks at the ghost's wispy hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not these hands, my other hands! The me that's at home in my study starting to smell a little funny! Norman looks sick and overwhelmed, but the ghost doesn't let up, swirling right up to his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get the book and read from it! Before the sun sets tonight!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But this is crazy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do I look crazy to you? Norman pauses a beat. Mr Prenderghast is floating upside down, various bits of bathroom detritus orbiting around him. A piece of toilet paper dangles off his nose. ParaNorman 28.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PRENDERGHAST GHOST (CONT'D) Tell me you'll do this!

direction.raw_text: Okay, okay, I promise...

direction.raw_text: That'll do! Mr Prenderghast's ghost begins to disappear, bubbling and melting at the edges like a burning photograph.

direction.raw_text: No! Mr Prenderghast, wait! Alvin, hearing only Norman's voice, gingerly peeks around the corner of his stall.

direction.raw_text: Sorry kid, I'm done here! I'm free! I'm finally free!

direction.raw_text: Wait! No, you can't leave now! Please! I don't understand. Mr Prenderghast hangs in the air a moment, face scrunched up as he awaits his release, CACKLING crazily. The ghost explodes into a million particles of light, blowing open the stall door and catapulting Alvin backwards across the room. The mirrors behind him crack and the light bulb shatters. From the floor, Alvin groggily looks up and sees Norman framed in the stall with the door hanging off its hinges. He reaches over and flushes the toilet.

direction.raw_text: Uh... yeah. You might want to give that a few minutes. He grabs his bag and runs out of the room. ParaNorman 29.

direction.raw_text: . SCHOOL HALLWAY, LOCKERS - CONTINUOUS 40 Norman sprints madly for the main doors, passing Neil and Salma who glance up from their lockers as he stumbles by.

direction.raw_text: Norman? Alvin tears around the corner in pursuit, but Neil stands in his way, waving his arms indignantly.

direction.raw_text: You're dead, freakshow! Do you hear me? D-E-D! DEAD! You're gonna be so dead you're gonna have to talk to yourself when you're dead!

direction.raw_text: I really don't think we should be leaving him.

direction.raw_text: He's probably up there right now fiddling with his ouija, or his orbs, or whatever it is he's got up there. This is not good.

direction.raw_text: . BABCOCK'S HOUSE, NORMAN'S BEDROOM - EARLY EVENING Norman paces his room looking pale and anxious as he hears the front door shut downstairs. Everywhere he turns he finds himself face to face with some zombie related novelty, from his lurid horror posters to his shelves of ghoulish action figures, and it's not doing anything for his nerves. His cell phone BEEPS from his pocket, giving him a start. He takes it out and reads a text; "COME TO THE WINDOW". Norman cautiously walks over and peers around the edge of the window frame. A figure stands motionless in the yard below, sheets of laundry billowing off the clothes line beside it. It stares up at Norman through the blank eye holes of a hockey mask. Norman GASPS and jumps back. With a frown, he re-emerges and opens the window. The figure lifts the mask, and Neil beams out from underneath, waving excitedly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wanna play some hockey? Norman SIGHS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've kinda got other things on my mind right now. Neil looks a little uncomfortable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it all that walking dead stuff again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr Prenderghast appeared to me in the bathroom!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ew. ParaNorman 31.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, his spirit! He says the witch's curse is real and I have to go up to the old graveyard to stop it! Before the sun sets tonight! Neil shifts uneasily as he processes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you wanna come play a bit later?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't you hear what I just said?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but I thought my idea was less likely to get us eaten. Norman knows he's on his own in this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just go home, Neil. I'm better off on my own anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go home! Norman reaches up and closes the window. Neil's shoulders sag and he turns away. Across the room, his Grandma materializes, and squints her eyes through the window as Neil awkwardly pulls himself over the garden fence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeez, who rattled your chains?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one. Norman isn't in the mood for any more discussion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad says I'm not supposed to talk to you any more, Grandma.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jackass. If I were a poltergeist I'd throw something at his head. Y'know, by rights I'm supposed to be frolicking in paradise with your grandfather, but I'm not. ParaNorman 32.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norman looks up as she drifts closer to the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So why did you stay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was never one for frolicking. I'll bet there's no cable or canasta up there either. Besides, I promised I'd always look out for you. She smiles, floating in a sitting position at the end of Norman's bed. She bobs gently, like a balloon. For a second, this seems to comfort Norman, but then another thought crosses his mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So it's your... duty?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a manner of speaking...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you'd do it no matter what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Even if it was something really scary... Grandma eyes him curiously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's nothing wrong with being scared Norman, so long as you don't let it change who you are. Norman thinks this over, then smiles up at her again. She goes to rub his head affectionately, but her ghost hand just passes right through his spiky hair. She gives him a wink, and drifts away through the wall. He is still scared, but now determined too. He steels himself and grabs his jacket from his bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BABCOCK'S HOUSE, COURTNEY'S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS The tiny room is crammed full of posters, pom-poms, plush toys and plastic trophies. Pretty much everything is pink. Courtney sits talking on her phone, cotton buds between her toes as her painted nails dry. ParaNorman 33.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I said to her, "Girl, come back and talk to me when your basket toss gets twelve thousand hits on YouTube!" Yeah, no, I said that. (listens and nods) Yeah, I'm stuck on lame patrol. Tonight's gonna be a total yawn. From downstairs, a door SLAMS. Courtney frowns, puts her hand over the phone and shouts out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norman?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BABCOCK'S HOUSE, FRONT YARD - MOMENTS LATER Beneath a florid evening sky, the Babcock's drive is in darkness. Pedalling furiously, Norman rides his bike out of the shadows into the light of the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) You better not be sneaking out you little weirdo!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SUBURBAN STREET - CONTINUOUS On a street corner two teenage girls approach Alvin and Pug, who have laid out a breakdancing mat and a beatbox and are doing their best to impress. Alvin imagines he is wowing the girls with his krumping, his ham-like limbs flying around and Pug hollering support, but in truth they watch in morbid fascination. A faint CLATTERING sound down the road grows louder. Norman suddenly THUNDERS past them on his bike, spinning Alvin on the spot and knocking him onto his butt. Show over, Alvin blunders to his feet, his eyes following Norman's trajectory up the dark road, and GROWLS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WOODED LANE, MR PRENDERGHAST'S HOUSE - EARLY EVENING 46 Tall conifers rise up high on either side of the road, now little more than a dirt track. Norman pedals up the hill and swerves, skidding to a stop in the gravel. He climbs off the bike, eyes fixed on a ramshackle house partially hidden in the foliage, its porch door swinging and CREAKING eerily in the breeze. He cautiously advances past a crooked mailbox on which is written "PRENDERGHAST", and steps onto the wooden porch. ParaNorman 34.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MR PRENDERGHAST'S HOUSE, HALLWAY - CONTINUOUS 47 The fading light of day spills across the floorboards and faded wallpaper of a long passage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? Mr Prenderghast? Motes of dust float around Norman as he moves slowly toward a door, slightly ajar, muttering to himself. He quietly makes his way past all manner of objects that epitomize the state of Mr Prenderghast's mind; a mannequin in a shopping cart, a pile of broken typewriters, a suspended bag of spoons, a closet full of identically soiled hobo suits, a Nordic track...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PRENDERGHAST'S HOUSE, STUDY - CONTINUOUS The study is filled with teetering piles of junk and old furniture draped over in dust sheets. A crucifix hangs over a metal cot with rumpled bedding. This is evidently where the old man lived his whole life. Starlight from a window picks out a macabre halo on a shape on the floor: Mr Prenderghast, dead where he fell, tightly clutching a leather-bound book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON Norman's face as he swallows nervously and steps closer to the body. He gingerly takes hold of the book and gives a gentle tug. It holds fast in the rigor mortis grasp. He tugs harder, shaking the book repeatedly, the corpse shaking with it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let go! Norman spends several strenuous moments dragging the body across the floorboards, Mr Prenderghast's head glancing off table legs and smacking repeatedly against the floorboards, as Norman tries to wrestle the book free. With a final yank the book pulls loose and, GASPING, Norman grips the book to his chest and runs to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WOODED LANE, MR PRENDERGHAST'S HOUSE - SAME Norman careens through the door, leaps off the porch and sprints along the wooded lane up the hill, watched by Alvin, concealed behind some bushes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WOODED HILLTOP, OLD CHAPEL GRAVEYARD - LATER Norman emerges from the woods, his long shadow preceding him as the sun begins its descent behind the tall trees. ParaNorman 35.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He pauses and stares out across weathered tombstones poking out amidst tangles of thorns. Clutching the book tight, Norman wrenches open the heavy gate, its rusted padlock crumbling apart. Eventually the track runs up to a stone slab surrounded on either side by thick bramble. Norman brushes aside vines and reads an epitaph engraved into the stone;
direction.name: direction

result.heading: MAY YOUR SOULS FIND EVENTUAL AND EVERLASTING SALVATION

direction.raw_text: . MAY YOUR SOULS FIND EVENTUAL AND EVERLASTING SALVATION. 1712." Norman pushes through the thick bushes into a secluded plot of land behind the slab with seven gravestones sticking out from the undergrowth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is it! The sun continues its descent, casting an ever lengthening shadow of treetops across the graveyard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Read from the book, stop the curse, go home and pretend this never happened. Norman steels himself, opens the book and starts to read.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Once upon a time, in a far-off land there lived a king and queen in a magnificent castle..." He pauses, confused by what he's reading.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? A fairy... tale...? A hand reaches over his shoulder from nowhere, whipping the book out of his grasp. He spins around to find Alvin standing behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What ya got there, Geekula? Norman launches himself at the book, but Alvin holds him back at arm's length.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give it back!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't wait to see everybody's faces when they hear about this one! ParaNorman 36.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, don't! Alvin!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! Nobody makes me miss out on a possible date with a girl that almost had some interest in talking to me. Yeah? Thought so! You got nothin' to say!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-oh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dang straight "uh-oh". That's what happens when Alvin gets around here. Uh-oh is that Alvin? Uh-oh Alvin's gonna make me run home to mommy. As Norman twists and wrestles against the bully the turbulent clouds in the sky above them twist and coalesce into the vague semblance of a huge grinning face. The face of a witch. There is an enormous RUMBLE and a flash of lightning silhouettes the boys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-oh. What is that? The wind has picked up, HOWLING through the gravestones. Norman looks at the face leering out of the clouds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's her! Another violent CRACK of thunder and flash of light, and the wind instantly cuts out. The boys stand stock still. Reaching down like a colossal arm, a great plume of cloud spirals over the cemetery, enveloping the tumbledown chapel and seeping around the gravestones. Fingers of murky fog slither across the ground, occasionally pausing and hanging in the air as though sniffing it. There is something eerily playful in the movement of the tendrils. The boys are jolted as an awful high pitched SCREAM blows through the graveyard like a shockwave, pulsing through the fog like a heartbeat. Norman and Alvin cover their ears and cower as the fog suddenly rears up like a claw and fiercely gouges into the earth in front of the boys. ParaNorman 37.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Silence, then the ground begins to RUMBLE beneath their feet and ripples beneath the tombstones. Stone slabs
direction.name: direction

result.heading: "HERE LIES BURIED THE SEVEN VICTIMS OF THE BLITHE HOLLOW CURSE

direction.raw_text: and shift. One CRACKS right through the center.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that sound? Norman watches, horrified, as the wet earth atop one of the graves splits and a skeletal hand bursts through! Norman watches as more graves bulge and break open and mud-encrusted shapes begin to emerge through the earth. The air is filled with anguished MOANING, the glowing fog dancing and whirling about the hatching figures. The two boys are rooted to the spot, mouths hanging open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON one of the figures crawling out of the ground into a patch of moonlight. Ragged and rotten it wears the mud-encrusted clothes of a colonial Puritan. It stares down at its hands, almost in disbelief, then lifts its face up to the sky and lets out a HOWL. Thunder that sounds like deep and abysmal LAUGHTER echoes through the turbulent clouds. The boys find themselves backed up against another headstone, this one engraved with the name "JUDGE HOPKINS". They leap aside as the ground swells beneath their feet, and the DEAD JUDGE punches through the dirt, bolt upright. His face wears a rictus grin and he looms over the boys like the Grim Reaper in a powdered wig. He tilts his head curiously when he sees the book in Alvin's hand, and HISSES through yellowed teeth. Norman makes a last ditch attempt at reading the book as the Dead Judge approaches, the other zombies gathering behind him.

direction.raw_text: Once upon a time in a far-off... Once upon a... In a...

direction.raw_text: It's not working! The Dead Judge gives a hideous GROWL, but Norman frowns, confused, because he can hear words.

direction.raw_text: !... YOU... MUST... STOP! ParaNorman 38.

direction.raw_text: Norman? What are you doing? I think I peed my pants! Survival instincts finally kick in and Alvin makes a run for it, scrambling through the graves toward the gate.

direction.raw_text: Wait! Norman follows, leapfrogging over headstones.

direction.raw_text: No, it's fine. He sucks. But I really gotta make sure he doesn't die or anything tonight. Will you help me? Please? Mitch gets an eyeful of her best damsel in distress act, then SIGHS.

direction.raw_text: Okay... I guess I should go get some clothes on. Courtney gives a disappointed WHINE as he heads off down the hall, shoving Neil's head as he goes.

direction.raw_text: Uh, is Norman in trouble?

direction.raw_text: He manages to think this through, and frowns. Alvin watches curiously as Norman turns his attention to the book, frowning as he runs his hand over the embossed leather cover.

Norman enters with purpose and approaches it, leaving Alvin horrified in the doorway. Norman crouches low over the body, holding the book out in front of Mr Prenderghast's blank eyes.

Norman narrows his eyes as he sees Mr Prenderghast's desk, still strewn with pictures and newspaper clippings. He hurries over and begins rummaging through the mess, scattering papers across the floor.

direction.raw_text: Come on! There has to be something...

direction.raw_text: We gotta defend ourselves! We gotta shoot them in the head with like silver stakes or something! I'm way too awesome to get eaten! Norman, are you listening to me? You really have to do something! Norman uncovers a couple of faded photographs of the old graveyard. One is of the seven tombstones, the other is of the stone marker, which reads "HERE LIES BURIED THE SEVEN VICTIMS OF THE WITCH'S CURSE..." Beside the photos is a torn page from an old book. An engraving illustrates the seven members of the witch's trial, solemnly seated at a bench within the courthouse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seven victims... Frowning, Norman glances up and sees a page from an old book tacked to the wall. It is an illustration of a hideous old crone, cackling evilly. Another THUMP from down the hall. Norman looks again from the photographs in his hand to the image of the old witch. There's something he's not seeing... He looks at the pictures in front of him. Graves. Jurors. Witch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seven graves. (EYES WIDEN) The witch's grave! It wasn't there! He turns to Alvin.

A figure limps slowly into the hallway, dragging one crippled foot behind the other. It stops halfway along and tilts its head, as if listening, and emits a dire

direction.raw_text: . MR PRENDERGHAST'S HOUSE, STUDY - CONTINUOUS The boys tremble in their hiding places trying not to make a sound; Alvin crouched behind a stack of books and Norman lying underneath the bed. The footsteps grow louder as the zombies shuffle into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - rotten legs step up to Mr Prenderghast's body, lying where he fell on the floorboards. Two withered feet suddenly step right up to the bed. Something drops onto the floor inches in front of Norman's face with an unpleasant SLAP. Norman's eyes bug out as he realizes it is a zombie's dislodged ear. A weltered arm reaches down to grope around for the body part, until Norman pushes the ear, as carefully as he can manage, back into the zombie's fingers. The hand retreats back out from under the bed. There is a loud SCREAM as Alvin, unable to contain himself any longer, jumps out from his hiding place and makes for the door. The corpses look up as he disappears down the hall, then stagger after him. Norman takes this chance to follow, but the Dead Judge blocks his exit. They both stand quite still, staring into each others' eyes. The corpse tilts its head, almost quizzically, and its eyes widen as it notices the book under his arm. Norman steps sideways to run past it, but the corpse does too. Both it and Norman step one way, then the other, and back again. Norman feigns one direction and quickly bolts in the other, past the corpse and out the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MR PRENDERGHAST'S HOUSE, HALLWAY - CONTINUOUS Alvin reaches the front door and throws it open. Directly in front of him is another zombie on the doorstep, opening a mouth full of jagged teeth. Alvin SCREAMS like a little girl, smacks it ineffectually with his spatula, and the door is abruptly SLAMMED in the zombie's face, a surprised and muffled GROAN coming from the other side. ParaNorman 44.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alvin, still screaming, looks down to see Norman beside him, leaning against the door. The Dead Judge leads the advance of zombies down the hall toward them. Norman hears his MOAN. Norman swings the door back open, the zombie on the other side moving with it, teeth firmly embedded in the wood. As it attempts to pry itself free, Norman grabs Alvin by the arm and they both dart onto the porch behind its back, headed for the road.

direction.raw_text: Come on!

direction.raw_text: And she said I could totally consider a career in formation swimming. But I was like, "I wanna do something that helps people less fortunate than me", thank you very much, y'know, like the poor or people who are like dying or ugly or something, `cuz I really think that ecology and world peace are like totally important today. Do you use free weights? Your deltoids are huge.

The tall dirty-looking figure stands stock still as the van plows straight into him. Dust flies up from the wheels of the van as it skids to an eventual stop in the center of the road.

direction.raw_text: . WOODED ROAD - CONTINUOUS 63 Mitch climbs out of the van and sees the figure lying still on the moonlit road. He nervously jogs over to it. As he gets closer, Mitch can see the man more clearly. He is wrapped in filthy tattered clothing of a bygone era and is covered in dirt. Flies BUZZ around him.

direction.raw_text: Er... hello, sir? He hunkers down and is immediately hit by the stench. A mud-encrusted face stares up at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON the van, as Courtney leans her head out.

direction.raw_text: ... I don't know! He's not moving! The figure's head lets out a faint GASP.

More corpses are emerging from the trees on either side of the road. She SCREAMS and leaps back into the van, as Mitch leaps into the driver's seat beside her.

direction.raw_text: Norman, what just happened?!

direction.raw_text: Zombies! I swear, okay? We saw them burst out of their graves! For real! He realizes Mitch and Courtney are staring at him, and tries to disguise his raw panic with nonchalance.

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (CONT'D) (TO COURTNEY) Just so you know, I totally saved his life, and I could totally save yours.

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Sorry, who are you?

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) I'm Alvin. I'm in his class. Norman, not so easily distracted from the problem at hand as the others, glances uneasily through the window.

direction.raw_text: - The zombies lurch arthritically toward the van, GROANING and GURGLING.

direction.raw_text: Mitch starts the engine with a YELL, just as the nearest zombie leers in through the window.

direction.raw_text: . WOODED ROAD - CONTINUOUS 65 CLOSE ON the front wheel, spinning and SQUEALING. The van spits out a cloud of exhaust fumes as it accelerates away. A beat as the smoke clears. The soot-covered zombies
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as they cough up what's left of their lungs. They turn from one to the other, awaiting direction from their leader. But the Dead Judge is nowhere to be seen. A zombie points down the winding road where the woods eventually thin out into leafy suburban drives. The ragged shape of the Judge is clinging to the back of the van, thrashing around and WAILING as it picks up speed. The zombies quietly watch until the van moves out of sight behind the trees, then turn their attention to the lights of the town center below them. They weigh up their options and, MOANING, shuffle toward civilization.

direction.raw_text: . SUBURBAN STREETS - NIGHT Further down the hill, Sheriff Hooper is taking a break from ticketing borderline traffic violations by drinking a giant malt shake in a plastic cup. She leans against her parked motorcycle, squinting up at the unnatural clouds.

direction.raw_text: Pesky kids with their cell phones burning up the oh-zone, that's what this is! She finishes her shake and throws the non-recyclable cup into the bushes. Mitch's van shoots past at high speed in a cloud of dust.

direction.raw_text: What the..? Hooper watches the van tear away, the dark shape of the Dead Judge visibly clinging to the back doors, his voluminous cape flapping out behind him like a windsock.

direction.raw_text: . WOODED ROAD, MITCH'S VAN - CONTINUOUS Unseen by the kids, the Dead Judge claws his way up the rear doors of the van by his ragged fingernails. ParaNorman 49.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MITCH'S VAN - CONTINUOUS 71 Courtney lets out an infuriated GROWL.

direction.raw_text: I just knew something like this was going to happen tonight!

direction.raw_text: You did? Wow, `cos that zombie bit really threw me. Courtney turns in her seat and glares at her brother.

direction.raw_text: Why d'you have to go and get everyone involved in all your weird stuff?!

direction.raw_text: Well, you weren't supposed to follow me, were you?

direction.raw_text: Sorry. My fault. When I'm nervous I get mouth diarrhoea.

direction.raw_text: Oh my gosh, I think I'm having an aneurism! This is so typical of you!

direction.raw_text: You don't understand! I'm the only one who can stop this, Courtney!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I understand! I understand that this is all getting completely out of... The van's sunroof is suddenly ripped open, and the Dead Judge's arm reaches down into the vehicle, clawing inches above Courtney's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...HAND! The Dead Judge leans further into the van, MOANING horribly. He seems to have his sights set on Norman, and reaches one arm down toward Norman and the book peeking out of his shoulder bag. Norman shrinks back as the zombie GROANS horribly. ParaNorman 50.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alvin disappears behind the back seat with a WHIMPER, but Neil valiantly leaps into the fray, wrestling the clawing fingers away from his friend.

direction.raw_text: Whaddawedo? Whaddawedo? Mitch?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know! I don't know!

direction.raw_text: You're the oldest!

direction.raw_text: Not mentally! Mitch hears a SIREN wail out behind him, and looks in his mirror to see the flashing light of Hooper's bike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh great. The cops. Hooper pulls level with the passenger seat window, waving angrily.

direction.raw_text: Pull over the vehicle! The Dead Judge leans further into the van, Neil hanging off him like a pendulum.

direction.raw_text: Norman! How do we stop them?! Norman looks again at the book in his hands.

direction.raw_text: I'm supposed to read from the book at the witch's grave!

direction.raw_text: We've got to go back to the graveyard?

direction.raw_text: She wasn't buried with the others. I don't know where else to look...

direction.raw_text: Well you better think of something quick! Norman wracks his brain.

direction.raw_text: . SALMA'S BEDROOM - NIGHT 75 Salma sits at her computer in an immaculately tidy bedroom. Even her collection of dolls are flawlessly groomed and sit on a shelf looking like they're waiting to be called in for an interview. Salma talks into her cell phone with an expression of withering disdain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So Norman, let me get this straight; you guys all go on this big supernatural adventure and you're calling me in the middle of the night because you need someone to help you do your homework?

direction.raw_text: Norman talks into his cell phone, occasionally ducking as Neil's flailing limbs are shaken from side to side by the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: upside down zombie hanging above their heads.

direction.raw_text: Uh... yeah.

direction.raw_text: . WOODED ROAD - CONTINUOUS Hooper steers her bike closer and swings her backside into the side of the van in an attempt to ram it off the road. The van lurches, flipping the Judge up and over the front of the vehicle, planting his face with a SQUELCH against the windscreen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MITCH'S VAN - CONTINUOUS Neil drops back down onto his seat. The Dead Judge's arm, torn off at the shoulder, is still clutched in his hands. He stares down at it, wide-eyed, as it wriggles like an animal in his grasp. The Dead Judge slides slowly down the windscreen of the van with a dull SQUEAK.

direction.raw_text: Mitch, do something! Mitch flicks on the windscreen wipers, which wipe the zombie's rotten flesh from side to side across the glass. Mitch and Courtney's eyes follow the Judge's movements from side to side. ParaNorman 52.

direction.raw_text: Behind them, Neil SQUEALS as the dismembered arm crawls all over him, fingers scuttling like a spider's legs. The arm frees itself from Neil and turns on Norman, leaping at him like a viper. Norman holds the book up as a shield, and manages to swat the zombie arm away, flipping it across the front seat, where it lands on the back of Mitch's neck. Mitch SCREAMS as the rotten hand clamps down onto the top of his head, and madly tries to shake it off. It hangs onto him grimly, bony fingers hooked around his nostrils. With Mitch no longer steering, the van swerves crazily across the road, shaking the Dead Judge off the windscreen. He disappears under the front of the vehicle, his one remaining arm clinging onto the underside.

direction.raw_text: Norman shouts pleadingly into the phone as he and Neil are flung violently from side to side across the back seat.
