direction.raw_text: Salma! We need to find out where the witch is buried! I went to the old graveyard but her grave wasn't there!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, duh. People found guilty of witchcraft weren't considered people anymore. Norman, your witch was buried someplace else... in an unmarked grave! (REPROACHFULLY) If you cared to pay attention some of the time, you would know that we covered this in fifth grade history class.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Salma! Please! Hurry! Y'know, I would Google this myself if there wasn't a 300 year old dead guy trying to rip my face off! With a SIGH, Salma types at her computer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. It says here she was tried in the old Town Hall on Main Street. There may be a record of her execution and burial in their archives. ParaNorman 53.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norman listens intently then shouts over to Mitch, still struggling with the zombie hand gripping his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quick! She said go to the Town Hall!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WOODED ROAD - CONTINUOUS Mitch hangs a sharp right and accelerates off the road and into thick undergrowth, sending up showers of twigs and thorns. Close on his heels, Hooper swerves her bike around in pursuit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SUBURBAN STREETS - NIGHT The six zombies inexorably continue their march, breaking cover from outlying woodland into the suburban streets of the town proper. At the bottom of a long driveway, spotlit by a street lamp, Mrs Henscher is taking out the trash in her bathrobe. She looks up from her garbage as the zombies approach. Her face is caked in a terrifying green avocado face mask. Barely a few feet in front of her, a similarly green face stares back, only this one has been dead for three hundred years. Henscher SCREAMS, bolting down the street like a runaway locomotive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WOODS, MITCH'S VAN - CONTINUOUS The van ploughs through bracken and bushes at breakneck speed. A little way behind, Hooper careens precariously in the van's wake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MITCH'S VAN - CONTINUOUS Mitch finally manages to pry the Dead Judge's arm off his head. He throws it, thrashing around violently, over his shoulder. Alvin lifts his face tentatively over the edge of the back seat to see what's going on. The zombie arm plants him in the eye, sending both sprawling against the floor. Alvin SQUEALS as the arm snakes around his neck into a bizarre approximation of a wrestling hold. ParaNorman 54.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WOODS - CONTINUOUS 83 Mitch swerves his van down the hill toward the more affluent suburbs of the town. Hooper's police bike bounces along behind them, red light flashing and SIREN wailing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . STATION WAGON, NEARBY ROAD - CONTINUOUS Perry and Sandra Babcock are driving home from their evening out. Neither look especially happy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I really think it might help if you tried to see things from his point of view.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . STATION WAGON - CONTINUOUS The Babcocks' discussion continues as they drive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perry, not believing in the Afterlife is like not believing in Astrology.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have no idea what you're talking about. Seriously, where did you learn that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Calm down. Perry rolls his eyes and GROANS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SUBURBAN STREET - CONTINUOUS Mitch's van explodes out of the thinning woods and back on to the winding hill road. Hooper careens through the trees behind it, but fails to make the turn and smashes through a fence across the other side of the road into a suburban back yard, splinters of fence showering down in her wake. Scattering lawn ornaments, plastic garden toys and deck furniture, Hooper rides directly up a kids' slide, shooting high up into the air like a rocket. ParaNorman 55.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SUBURBAN INTERSECTION - CONTINUOUS 87 Preceded by an ear-splittingly guttural WAIL, Mrs Henscher runs through the streets, waving her arms about hysterically. Moments later, the Babcocks' station wagon pulls around the corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SUBURBAN INTERSECTION - CONTINUOUS Mitch's van SCREECHES through the intersection, swerving in front of the Babcock's station wagon, which veers wildly as Perry brakes hard. He leaps out of the car as the van drives away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Delinquent drivers! Where are the police when you need them? Hooper's bike hurtles through the air and bounces off the hood of the station wagon with a CRUNCH. Before Perry can react he is buried under the mass of Sheriff Hooper, dropping like a meteorite onto his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MITCH'S VAN - CONTINUOUS The kids, hanging on for dear life, hear a loud CRUNCH from the back of the van. They all turn to see the van's rear doors ripped open. Silhouetted in the space is the one-armed Dead Judge, cape muddied and torn from his crawling back out from the vehicle's undercarriage. The zombie lunges toward the startled kids, and MOANS. Mitch turns his attention back to the road ahead, but too late, and he YELLS as green-faced Mrs Henscher runs
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: into the van's headlights. Mitch throws all his weight onto the wheel, tires
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as the van misses Henscher by inches. The violence of the turn flings the Dead Judge backwards like a slingshot, disappearing out of the doors and shattering into a dozen pieces as he SMASHES into the hard road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SUBURBAN BACK YARDS - CONTINUOUS Having completely lost control, Mitch's van ploughs through cookie-cutter back yards. ParaNorman 56.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It bounces down the hill, flipping over and over, the kids inside tossed around like rag dolls. Somewhat the worse for wear, it eventually comes to a stop in a parking lot, neatly crashing into an empty space.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKING LOT - CONTINUOUS The kids clamber out of the far side of the van.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my gosh! I'm gonna be sick!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I broke a nail! As Alvin climbs out, he gingerly holds up the Judge's arm, as if it were a dead animal, and dangles it limply in front of his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah! Alvin the zombie slayer! I got you... The hand suddenly bends back on itself, slaps him on the face, and as he SQUEALS it drops to the ground and skitters away into the shadows. Mitch sizes up what's left of his van, and bids a tearful farewell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baby, I'm so sorry. You'll be alright. We're gonna get through this together. Courtney pouts moodily when she realizes the tender words aren't for her. Norman looks up at the sky. A thick bank of cloud looms over the town, and in its center is the unmistakable otherworldly face, ebbing in and out of visibility, and grinning horribly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh oh. C'mon!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yeah! Neil HUMS his very own action movie score as he runs to follow Norman out of the parking lot. ParaNorman 57.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perfect. Now the geeks are in charge. The kids make toward the parking lot exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MAIN STREET ALLEYWAY - SOME TIME LATER The town center retains even less charm when the sun goes down, and its remaining denizens are now drunk, high or looking for trouble. Provided one requires alcohol, junk food or pharmaceuticals, it's the place to be. A ruddy-faced drunk, SLOB GUY, inserts a few coins in a vending machine at the end of an alley, and waits as the metal coil inside curls a candy bar toward the front of the machine. The man notices the approaching figures further down the back street and frowns. He turns back to the machine, waiting. The zombies draw closer, GROANING, and the man fidgets uncomfortably. The man begins WHIMPERING. The candy bar slowly shifts forward. The zombies are close enough to touch. The man YELLS and runs away, leaving the candy bar to drop to the machine's trough with a CLANG. A beat then, still SCREAMING, the man runs back to the machine, grabs his candy, then runs away again. The Undead emerge onto Main Street, and slow down as they take in their surroundings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S ON the garish town center nightlife intercut with CLOSE-UPS of the wide-eyed zombies. -Two teenage girls in mini-skirts walk along the curb. A pickup truck crawls by, driven by red necks who wolf- whistle and gesture rudely. The girls GIGGLE. -In the nearby "GOBBLER'S" parking lot, a huge woman sits in her vehicle cramming a burger into her mouth. As she bites down ketchup spatters across the inside of the windscreen like arterial spray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: corpse stands agog before a billboard. The poster is for a line of "Lady Luck" lingerie and features a buxom woman in her underwear draped over a roulette wheel. The tagline is "FANCY YOUR CHANCES?" The corpse's one eye pops out of its socket and dangles by its optic nerve. -Outside the Bar Gento, LOUD MUSIC and raucous revelry blare out into the street. ParaNorman 58.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -A group of loitering teens cluster in a group, some sitting upon a stolen shopping cart, others kicking a tin can from one to the other. One daubs misspelled naughty words on the wall beside them. Another is attempting to use his bare hands to rip open a parking meter. -Another corpse stands in the light of a store window, a bank of TVs showing all kinds of programs. Racing car explosions; scantily-clad singers gyrating in music videos; talking animals and Viagra commercials.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as they all raise rotten fingers to their mouths and SCREAM. Slob Guy suddenly bursts out of the door of the Bar Gento, dragging a group of dubious drinkers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See! I told you! Zombies! It's the witch's curse! Everyone in the street freezes in place, wide-eyed. Someone GASPS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mama?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? A couple of the zombies exchange glances, waiting for the other shoe to drop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What should we do? Barely skipping a beat, the townsfolk shift seamlessly from shock and awe to bullish aggression. Crystal pulls a pump-action shotgun from somewhere about her person and scowls menacingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kill them in the head! Within seconds, the seedy-looking townsfolk have armed themselves with pool cues, mops, toilet plungers and any other household implements that can be waved threateningly, and the mob advances on the group of quivering zombies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . URBAN STREETS - CONTINUOUS The disembodied Judge's arm skitters along a secluded street, eventually coming upon the rest of the Dead Judge, sitting in the gutter trying to arrange and re- attach his body parts in the right places. ParaNorman 59.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Having SNAPPED his head back onto his neck, the Judge scoops up his remaining arm and gets unsteadily to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MAIN STREET - MOMENTS LATER NORMAN Hurry! This way! Norman leads the way, but stops dead as they run headlong into a scene of zombie invasion mayhem. Townsfolk fill the streets, SHOUTING and acting generally mob-like. One or two of them have even got hold of burning torches from somewhere. It's apocalyptic chaos. The fat woman from the Drive-Thru runs past SCREAMING, her face and T-shirt covered in blood-red ketchup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, this is awful! The zombies are, like, eating everyone! Norman points beyond the bedlam to the dark shape of the Old Town Hall in the plaza.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon! They skirt around the edge of Main Street, avoiding flying bottles and limbs as best they can. Following the noise, the Judge staggers along some way behind. He surveys the scene as he emerges, his featureless face doing a nevertheless effective job of expressing horrified shock. After a moment, he comes to his senses, and spies the kids in the distance. A look of resolve crosses his face, turning quickly to surprise as a SHOT rings out nearby. The Judge looks down to a large hole blown through his midriff. Framed within it is Crystal, several feet away, rifle smoking. He looks up again, weighs up his chances, then lets out a ROAR of retreat to his beleaguered companions before running off into the shadows. Those zombies who haven't already tried to run for cover manage to extricate themselves from the frenzy and follow the Judge's CRY, some of them breaking into a sprint.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOWN HALL PLAZA - NIGHT Formerly the district courthouse, the Town Hall has now been relegated to storing the local archives. ParaNorman 60.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is an old timber building, surrounded by graceless modern office blocks around the cobbled square. The kids race across the plaza, pausing to catch their breath at the ugly witch statue in front of the Town Hall. They GASP as they slow their pace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is everyone alright? Nobody got bitten? Neil flops down heavily against the statue, panting and holding his mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I bid dy tongue! Dud dat count? Norman moves toward the steps leading up to the Town Hall's doors, the rest of the gang falling into line behind him. Another flash of lightning paints the kids' shadows across the width of the square. Norman nervously watches the clouds above them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does anyone know how to pick a lock? Everyone immediately looks at Alvin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. Picking locks is my thing. Alvin walks over to a notice board beside the door, upon which is a poster for a "CRIME PREVENTION SEMINAR". He yanks it out of the ground, hefts it through the window, then reaches through to unfasten the door latch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOWN HALL LOBBY - CONTINUOUS The kids hurry through the door. The lobby is dark, but moonlight glistens off polished wood through a lofty circular window. Norman shouts out from the other side of the lobby, where he stands beside a door labelled "HALL OF RECORDS"..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is it! ParaNorman 61.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now we can find out where the witch was buried! Norman pushes his shoulder against the door and steps inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOWN HALL ARCHIVES - CONTINUOUS The door swings open and reveals a labyrinth of shelves and glass cabinets stretching out into the shadows in front of him. Row after row of dusty cardboard file boxes and ledgers stacked one on top of another. Norman stops in his tracks, color draining from his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-oh. Courtney follows, faking enthusiasm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great! I'm super psyched! This is turning into the most fun night ever! The overhead light clicks on as Alvin steps into the room behind her and GROANS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man. Zombies take over the world and we lock ourselves in a library. Are you kidding me? There's an adult video store just across the street! Neil is more optimistic, and brightly makes his way over to a shelf, and pulls down a slim ledger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This'll be a piece of cake, you'll see. He pauses, and frowns, squinting up his eyes as he reads aloud, very slowly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Page... One... Okay, page one. Mitch hefts a particularly heavy box file off a shelf. He seems to read the filing notes written across its front, then ignores them and begins curling it like a dumbbell. ParaNorman 62.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I really hate these places. Norman sizes up the masses of documents all around them, face panicked. It would take days to go through them all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on! No, that's not it. Time is running out!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MAIN STREET - CONTINUOUS 110 Sheriff Hooper looks around and sees an awful lot of armed people beginning to bay for blood, and she sees trouble on her hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ain't room for no more zombies in this town! Standing behind him, Teddy agrees with a slack-jawed
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . STATION WAGON - NIGHT Perry drives into town in silence, his nose bloodied and stuffed with tissues. Sandra sits beside him and Sheriff Hooper is in the back seat, scouring the streets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would've been a quiet night too, if it hadn't been for those meddling kids. Huh! As Perry and Sandra exchange uneasy glances, Hooper suddenly points through the windshield to the riot in progress on Main Street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sweet baby jinkies!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MAIN STREET - CONTINUOUS Perry brakes hard just a few feet in front of the advancing mob, moving menacingly en masse in pursuit of the fleeing Undead. Hooper bustles out of the car, making a beeline for Deputy Dwayne. Crystal turns and fires into the street, taking out a lightbulb over a store sign. A dog somewhere in the shadows YELPS and runs away. ParaNorman 63.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sheriff Hooper is outraged, and snatches the gun out of Crystal's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think you're doing, firing at civilians? That is for the police to do!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay Sheriff, we've only been shooting at the dead ones! It's the living dead, come to take us all to Hell! We gotta stop them before they get away!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOWN HALL - MOMENTS LATER In the alley down the side of the old Town Hall, the zombies tiptoe through the shadows. They look slightly the worse for wear; some have lost limbs, others have large holes in them. One has a toilet plunger stuck on her head. The Dead Judge looks up at the sky. The turgid supernatural storm RUMBLES closer, pressing down upon the nearby rooftops. The Judge motions to the other zombies to hurry, and grabs hold of the Town Hall's side door. He rips it open, and furtively motions the zombies to file inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MAIN STREET - CONTINUOUS SHERIFF HOOPER Move along now people, there isn't anything to see here! The townsfolk around her refuse to be allayed by this. Perry and Sandra have emerged dubiously out of their car and watch from the periphery, utterly bewildered. Mrs Henscher, newly arrived and wearing her avocado face mask like war paint, shakes her shotgun and points down the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saw them! I saw them! The zombies are in the Town Hall! The information sweeps across the crowd like wildfire. Several faces turn to Henscher, who is pleased to have an engaged audience and hams it up shamelessly, coming on like Braveheart in curlers. ParaNorman 64.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MRS HENSCHER (CONT'D) Cry "Havoc!" and let slip the dogs of war! The faces around her don't react; waiting patiently for a clearer translation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's rip `em apart! Mrs Henscher points the crowd toward the Town Hall. Despite Hooper's protests, the townsfolk are on lynch mob auto pilot and surge like a force of nature along the Main Street toward the Town Hall plaza.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOWN HALL, ARCHIVES - LATER Dozens of books and cardboard boxes lie scattered across the floor. The glass cabinets around the room have been ransacked as the kids drag documents off shelves and rummage through binders. Norman sits on the floor flipping through sheet after sheet of records. Courtney wades through documents toward him, holding up a fist full of old rolled-up papers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not going to find it in here, Norman! This is useless!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I know, and it's also really boring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought I was driving the van. No one told me I was gonna have to do this other dumb stuff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I'd known there was so much reading involved, I would have brought a completely different group of people who hate me. Neil suddenly YELLS out victoriously. Everyone turns to him, hardly believing he might have found the answer. He waves a book triumphantly above his head and grins at everyone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes! Book number one! Finished! That is right, twenty six pages, oh yeah! Everyone GROANS and turns back to their bickering. ParaNorman 65.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't believe this is your plan! I'm gonna get bitten and start eating peoples' brains! I'm supposed to be Vegan! Mitch suddenly SHOUTS out from the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guys! There's something moving out there! I think it's the zombies!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hide!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, no it's not. It's just grown- ups.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hide!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOWN HALL - SAME The square outside is awash with threatening townsfolk, led by Mrs Henscher and Deputy Dwayne. Some charge up the Town Hall steps, JEERING and WHISTLING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOWN HALL LOBBY - CONTINUOUS Blurry silhouettes move across the outside of the window, occasionally SMACKING against them with their fists. A brick SMASHES through a window and CLATTERS across the floor between Courtney's feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOWN HALL ARCHIVES - CONTINUOUS The kids start to hurry toward the lobby, leaving Norman sitting amongst the spilled documents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That sound. Y'know what that is? That's not awesome... things...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guys, come on!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just give it up, weiner!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to keep trying! ParaNorman 66.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We tried and look what happened! (SIGHS) I'm scared, Norman, and I can't listen to this any more. Norman looks at the faces in front of him. The kids are scared and confused and angry. Even Neil has nothing encouraging to offer. Norman's brow furrows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You never listen! No one ever listens! I'm scared too, but I've still gotta do this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do too listen! And whatever it was you just said, it's not working! You think you're going to go out there and do your talking to the dead thing and this is all going to be okay? What are you going to do, ask the zombies not to eat you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should've known you wouldn't understand! No one ever does!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norman, you need to stop all this weird stuff and start living in the real world!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone in the real world thinks I'm a freak! And you know what, maybe they're right, maybe I am a freak! But I never asked for your help... just go! Get out! Courtney, Mitch and Alvin back off a half step as Norman advances on them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeez, that was dramatic. Courtney shoots him a look as if she's about to fight back, then shakes her head and shoves her way through the door. She turns to go, snapping at the other kids behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon! ParaNorman 67.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One by one, the kids turn and file out, but Neil still insists on remaining, folding his arms defiantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not going anywhere. You can't make me. Mitch shrugs and picks his brother up, scooping him under one arm and carrying him out the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dude, you're really heavy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not speaking to you. You can't make me. Norman watches the doors shut behind them, and his anger begins to ebb. Alone in the archive room, he slumps to his knees feeling useless and frustrated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOWN HALL LOBBY - CONTINUOUS In the lobby, no one can hear him over the sounds of the mob. The kids have nervously approached the barricade at the front door, hoping to appeal to the figures outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um, excuse me? Hello? Unmistakably living hands and arms suddenly SMASH through the barricade, clawing into the Town Hall. The kids recoil from the windows, SCREAMING as they bat ineffectually at the grasping hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOWN HALL - CONTINUOUS Slob Guy reaches in through a gap in the broken woodwork, managing to grab a hold of something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're in there alright! I can feel its clammy flesh!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOWN HALL LOBBY - CONTINUOUS Neil SCREAMS as Slob Guy gropes at his chubby arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOWN HALL ARCHIVES - CONTINUOUS 117A Norman notices his backpack on the floor in front of him, the book of fairy tales poking out. He picks it up and runs his hand absently over the embossed leather cover. ParaNorman 68.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 117A Something CLATTERS behind him, and Norman hears someone approaching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? He turns around to face his friend and finds himself staring up at a zombie, moving toward him along the dark aisle, pale moonlight shining off its exposed bones. Norman GASPS. He realizes zombies are converging on him from all directions, barring his way out through the door. The Dead Judge GROANS as he approaches. Norman backs away, clutching the book to his chest. Out of the corner of his eye Norman spots another doorway in the shadows of the wall behind him and moves toward it, calling out desperately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help! Somebody help me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOWN HALL STAIRWELL - CONTINUOUS Norman runs up a tight stairwell leading to the roof of the building, the zombies just a few steps beneath him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOWN HALL - CONTINUOUS 119 MRS HENSCHER Let's burn `em out! Obligingly, a couple of townsfolk hurl Molotov cocktails at the windows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOWN HALL LOBBY - MOMENTS LATER The kids manage to pull back just as a burning bottle flies over their heads, SHATTERING glass. It lands in the middle of the room and a puddle of burning alcohol spreads across the floorboards. Tendrils of black smoke are also beginning to creep under the edge of the front door. The kids stand in a group, terror-stricken as the smoke thickens and flames begin to lick along the floor. Courtney is quick to lose what remains of her composure. ParaNorman 69.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're all gonna DIE!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOWN HALL, ROOFTOP - CONTINUOUS 121 Norman heaves himself through a tiny hatchway onto a flat roof at the highest point of the building. He shuts the hatch, inching away as the zombies beneath beat on it with their hands. Norman finds himself backed up against a flimsy wooden rail, which CREAKS warningly. He leans over and sees the square beneath, filled with angry people. He has nowhere left to run. Above him the red sky RUMBLES, clouds churning into a ghastly grinning mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOWN HALL - CONTINUOUS Far below, the gathered townsfolk grow increasingly erratic. A pair of visiting tourists happily take in their surroundings with their cell phones and cameras. Sandra tugs at her husband's arm as they are buffeted by the increasingly erratic townsfolk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my gosh, do you think this has got anything to do with Norman? Perry waves her hand away irritably.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course not! He is interrupted by a SHOUT as someone sees Norman's tiny figure silhouetted against the raging sky on the roof of the building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone look! Perry and Sandra see their son begin gesticulating wildly at the clouds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perry, do something! He cups his hands around his mouth and YELLS at Norman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norman! Get down from there this instant! You're supposed to be grounded! ParaNorman 70.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOWN HALL, ROOFTOP - CONTINUOUS 123 Distraught, Norman bellows into the sky, waving the book angrily above his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You horrible old witch! Is this what you want? The roiling face above him seems to CACKLE mercilessly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOWN HALL - CONTINUOUS The mob begins to lurch to all new stupid conclusions as Norman waves his arms at the clouds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Necromancer!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is all his doing!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norman! Perry feels the shift in the crowd. They're not just baying for blood. They're about to start baying for his son's blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOWN HALL, ROOFTOP - CONTINUOUS Norman continues YELLING at the sky, waving the book. He madly flicks through the pages, attempting to read aloud over the ROARING wind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Once upon a time in a far-off land there lived a king and queen... in a magnificent castle... The horrible cloud face above him CACKLES monstrously, drowning out the story.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why won't you listen to me? Why are you doing this?! The face in the clouds turns inside out as a tongue of lightning spits out. It SMACKS into the book held in front of Norman's chest, lifts him up off his feet and throws him back onto the old timbers of the roof. The air is knocked out of Norman as, trailing smoke, he
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: through the wood into the fiery chasm of the building beneath. ParaNorman 71.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: CAMERA follows him as he plummets, SCREAMING, and is enveloped in thick black smoke. There is a loud THUD, and silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOWN HALL, OLD COURTHOUSE - CONTINUOUS Norman lies on the floor, shifting painfully. With some effort he sits up, rubbing his head. The book in his hand is now a blackened cinder with a large smoldering hole gouged through the middle. Norman realizes he is no longer inside the burning building. Around him indistinct shapes begin to pool into clarity. He is in the courthouse, but three hundred years ago, and a trial is about to begin. A crowd of onlookers gather around a platform at the head of the room where officious-looking gentlemen in austere Puritan clothing stand around a table. Two dour men in black skull caps are seated, an empty chair between them. Norman moves unnoticed through the crowd toward the platform. The hubbub of the townsfolk dies down. The imposing figure of Judge Hopkins, tall and august, marches out of a side chamber, steps up onto the wooden dais and seats himself silently between his solemn peers. He glares down at Norman with cold, humorless eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agatha Prenderghast of his Majesty's Province of Massachusetts... As the Judge's voice continues, Norman sees played out against it a MONTAGE of the preceding court case. The notary stands up, waving a wad of testimonies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) ...on this day you have been arraigned for the horrible crime of witchcraft... A pale woman fiddles nervously with the ribbon on her bonnet as she is questioned by the Judge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) ...witnessed by those whose testimonies have been heard. A wiry woman with a pinched face gestures fearfully with her arms as she recounts her evidence. ParaNorman 72.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: JUDGE HOPKINS (V.O.) (CONT'D) You have, by this court, been found guilty...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! A young farmhand bows his head shamefully, as he adds further ammunition to the prosecution.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) ...and it is passed on you, according to your grievous crimes... Another village woman SOBS into a handkerchief as she tells her story.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of the accusers, one after the other, as the Judge finishes his verdict. The notary, the preacher, the townsfolk. All point at Norman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...execution. Camera swings slowly around Norman to reveal AGGIE PRENDERGHAST, standing in chains right behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! Norman reacts with horror. The "witch" cowering next to him is no more than eleven years-old. Her long hair is unkempt and dirt on her face is streaked with tears from her eyes. Her manacles have been specially made to fit her tiny wrists, and weigh her to the floor. She SNIFFS, scared and confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have anything to say for yourself?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was only playing!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aye, with fire! You were speaking with the dead! The crowd GASPS and MURMURS fearfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll not risk damnation on these good people. The town Sheriff grabs Aggie by the shoulder. ParaNorman 73.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: JUDGE HOPKINS (CONT'D) You are to be taken to the place of execution where you will be hanged by the neck until you be dead... Norman shouts out but no one can hear or see him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait! No! You can't do this! The grim-faced Sheriff moves toward Norman and Aggie. She backs away, tears flowing down her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't do anything wrong! A terrible panic comes over her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop! Leave me alone or I'll make you sorry! I'll make all of you sorry! Norman feels unsteady on his feet, the room seeming to spin around him. The faces of the townsfolk, pale and skull-like, swirl around and around, blurring together. In the center of it all, glowing like a bonfire, Aggie
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The world turns black and Norman collapses in a faint.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOWN HALL ARCHIVES - CONTINUOUS NORMAN'S P.O.V. - the high timbers of the hall roof swim into focus, and then faces peering down at him. Skeletal, rotting faces. The dead Puritans are standing around him in a half-circle. He sits up terrified, and looks around, shuffling back across the floorboards on his bottom. The dead villagers stand where they are, staring intently. Norman sits a moment, heart pounding, WHISPERING SHAKILY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How could you?! She was just a little kid! She was no different than me! The Dead Judge takes a step forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep away from me! The Dead Judge stops, then opens his horrible mouth and speaks in a guttural voice. ParaNorman 74.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You... must... stop... the... curse. A beat. Norman is stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? You don't want to kill me? The Judge shakes his head and points down at the book beside Norman's feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can speak to the dead. To us. To her. We need you to read from the book to send us all back to the grave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it didn't work! It's a fairy tale! Just a bedtime... story... He narrows his eyes at the Judge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's it, isn't it? A bedtime story to keep a little girl asleep for another year. And now you need my help because I'm the only one who can read it to her! He bends down to pick it up. His eyes flash angrily at the zombies and he hurls the burnt book at the Judge. It hits him in the chest and falls to his feet with a THUD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here's your book! Try reading it yourself! The zombies stare down at the blackened lump of charred paper, and several of them GASP. The Dead Judge's eyes are filled with fear and desperation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why did you do it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of her. (GESTURES BEHIND) I believed we were doing what was right. I was wrong. Now this is our punishment. (MORE) ParaNorman 75.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DEAD JUDGE (CONT'D) We thought we knew our way in life but in death we are lost. Norman knows they're telling the truth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please help us. Norman looks at the book of fairy tales, lying at his feet. Its pages are curled and blackened, embers still glowing around the hole blown right through it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Every year someone reads the story at her grave. Before me it was Mr Prenderghast, and before him there were others, but the curse doesn't ever go away. Nothing gets better. It's not enough. Norman looks at it a moment, thinking. He knows what he has to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What will you do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something nobody ever did before. I've gotta go talk to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOWN HALL - CONTINUOUS Smeared with soot and COUGHING, the kids are trapped in the lobby. They cower together as burning wood CREAKS and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: all around them. The air is grey and caustic and filled with flakes of charcoal and burning ash. A burning timber GROANS as it splits from the ceiling and tumbles toward the children. They SCREAM and scatter as it hits the floorboards in a shower of glowing sparks. Mitch shouts out from beside a heavy wooden counter top.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guys! Guys! Under here! Under here! The kids scramble beneath the shelter of the counter as more glowing embers rain down around them. Courtney grabs Mitch by the bicep and whispers weakly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mitch, if we die tonight, this might be the last chance I get to tell you how I feel. ParaNorman 76.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, well, no. Unless we get brought back as zombies, and then technically you'll have longer. Courtney opens her mouth to continue, but her love train is thoroughly derailed by the nearby CRASH of breaking wood, and the archive door beside them CLATTERS to the ground. The cowering kids all watch in silent horror as several dark figures limp and shamble out of the smoke and make their way past them across the room. It's the zombies, and they're being led by Norman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norman?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on! This way!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've gotta be kidding me... Norman, his mouth shielded by his sleeve, heads purposefully toward the front doors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOWN HALL - MOMENTS LATER A loud THUD from within the Town Hall causes the gathered crowd outside to GASP, and those closest to the doors to take a few steps back. The crowd GASPS again as the charred front door of the Town Hall is wrenched off its hinges by a huge piece of timber and CRASHES down the steps in a shower of flaming splinters. A ripple of shock runs through the crowd as a number of skeletal figures emerge, SPLUTTERING and WHEEZING through the smoke, shielding their faces from the heat. The gathered crowd are even more aghast when they realize a child is being guided out of the flames by the zombies. Unseen by the crowd, Courtney and the other kids crawl to the splintered opening of the front door, blinking and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: for air. Hooper pulls out her gun and marches toward the zombies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You stay right where you are! You may be dead already, but I will still shoot you! ParaNorman 77.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The zombies stop on the steps, burning building behind them and the hostile townsfolk in front of them. Norman pushes through and stands firmly in the way of Hooper's gun, arms spread defensively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait! Courtney and the other kids GASP as they watch from within the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my gosh! Far above, the clouds THUNDER like demonic laughter. Perry steps forward, face red.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Son! Step away from the zombies!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! I won't! Sandra comes up behind her husband and holds his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perry, calm down! You're going to have a heart attack and then what are you going to do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll come back and haunt Norman! Maybe then he'll start listening to me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! You don't understand what's happening here! I spoke to them and it's not what you think! Courtney edges forward out of the doorway, shocked but transfixed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The curse isn't about the zombies hurting you! It's about you hurting them! I figured it out, and I know a way to stop this!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's in league with them! A few members of the crowd try to push past Perry toward the steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's hang him! ParaNorman 78.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! We can't hang him, stupid! It's the 21st Century!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then let's burn him! Sandra turns despairingly to the crowd behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you stop being a mob for just one minute?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen to me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get them before they eat us! Punctuating every shout, the roiling clouds continue to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: their horrible laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave him alone! Courtney suddenly emerges, standing right in front of Norman. Following her lead in true "I'm Spartacus!" fashion, Neil, Mitch and Alvin step forward too, creating a barrier all around him, all joining hands in solidarity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON Courtney's face as she hisses sidelong to Alvin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hand, Alvin! My hand! A ripple of confusion seems to run through the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody, listen up! You all need to stop trying to kill my brother! You're adults! Stop it! I know that this seems crazy, believe me I'm with you on that, but I think he does actually know what he's talking about!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All night he's been trying to save you from the witch's curse!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, and all you want to do is burn and murder stuff, burn and murder stuff! Just burning and murdering! ParaNorman 79.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shame on every single one of you! How dare you all! Amongst the crowd, doubt is beginning to show. Even the rumbling clouds have gone quiet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So they're not going to hurt us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, does it look like any of them are trying to hurt you? They're just people. At least they used to be. Just stupid people who should have known better. Norman looks at the line of Puritans. They look quite sad and pathetic really. Hardly monstrous at all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They did something unforgivable because they were scared, and they were cursed for it. Now it's happening all over again. Don't you get it? They were just like you. But now it has to stop. For good. Across the crowd, weapons are being lowered and faces are starting to look a little guilty. There is silence as the modern townsfolk stare at the line of three hundred year-old townsfolk. Throughout the crowd various weapons CLATTER as they hit the ground. A small girl tiptoes up the steps and silently offers one of the zombies his arm back. The quiet is shattered by a deafening SCREAM. It blows out of the storm clouds and whips through the plaza on a hellish wind. The street lamps around the square shatter in bursts of sparks, raining down on the amassed people. The sky above is blood red, clouds twisting and contorting into a vast unnatural vortex. The Town Hall erupts in a fireball, tongues of white fire
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: out of the embers as the ground shakes and the crowd scatters in terror. Neil turns to Norman as they duck for cover behind a parked car, and SHOUTS over the noise of the wind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeez, what is her problem? Norman takes in the chaos around them... ParaNorman 80.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -An arc of white lightning hits the base of the witch's statue with a CRACK. With a terrible GROAN, the statue is lifted up into the air by the supernatural wind. It
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: down at the foot of the Town Hall steps, shattering into a hundred pieces of rubble. -Windows blow out of tacky tourist stores, their cheap front displays ripped apart by the wind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: bolt of lightning tears through the huge billboard in the plaza, ripping apart the idealized image of the town's history in a spiral of splintered wood. Norman struggles over to where a group of townsfolk and zombies cower from the destruction. Sandra runs over to her son and hugs him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Norman!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what do we do now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I really don't know...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes you do, Norman! You've got to get to that witch's grave!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But nothing! You listen to me, buster, we didn't turn away when Daleridge High was slaughtering our volleyball team, did we?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought we did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No we didn't. I've cheered the uncheerable, Norman, and I'm not letting you give up now! Norman turns to Perry, his eyes all business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad, could I borrow the car?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me? ParaNorman 81.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norman looks squarely at his dad, and the Dead Judge beside him. They exchange uneasy glances.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . STATION WAGON - CONTINUOUS The Dead Judge sits rigidly between Norman and Courtney in the back of Perry's station wagon, Perry and Sandra in the front. Perry drives in silent discomfort following the Judge's instructions through town, glancing in his rear-view mirror at the passengers in the back seat. Sandra takes a small perfume spritzer from her purse as surreptitiously as she can and sprays the air around her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SUBURBAN STREETS - CONTINUOUS The car turns a corner into the path of an overturned truck, caught by the spectral wind. It cartwheels down the middle of the street, tearing up the asphalt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . STATION WAGON - CONTINUOUS Perry swerves out of its path of destruction. Inside, Sandra cranes her neck around to watch the truck
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: down the road behind them. She faces front again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boy, the traffic tonight!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norman! He's on my side of the seat!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She wants you to move over. The Judge MUMBLES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard that! Mom! Tell the zombie to stop saying stuff about me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you quit using the "z" word?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So help me I will stop this car right now if all three of you don't quit it this instant! ParaNorman 82.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After a moment, the Judge lets out a sepulchral MOAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He says "take a left here". Perry gives a distasteful look, but turns the steering wheel. He peers out through the raging storm, windscreen wiper batting ineffectively at the onslaught of debris.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've already been this way. We're going around in circles!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe we should pull over and ask someone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, right, you think maybe we should stop at a graveyard and dig up some other eighteenth-century corpses?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not a bad idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wish I understood you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . STATION WAGON - CONTINUOUS From the back seat, the Judge turns to Norman and GROANS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please don't tell me he needs to use the bathroom. Norman listens as the Judge continues GRUMBLING, then leans forward over his father's seat, pointing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turn down there!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . OLD FOREST TRAIL - CONTINUOUS The car turns tightly off a secluded road onto a dirt path running into the thick of the surrounding woodland.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my, do you think that's it? ParaNorman 83.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . OLD FOREST TRAIL - MOMENTS LATER 139 The headlights of the car illuminate a huge fallen trunk ahead along the path, and Perry pulls the car to a stop, wheels CRUNCHING on dirt and roots. Everyone gets out of the car. The trees around them are thick and dense. Aggie's furious storm WHISTLES through the branches far above them. Norman turns to the Dead Judge. The Judge nods solemnly, pointing ahead. Norman steels himself and begins to march forward through the thick brambles, the others following behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, why are we here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone's gotta talk to her, Dad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, um, why's that person you, exactly? As they continue, the surrounding trees press in on them, just like in Norman's vision. Branches and thorns lash at their faces while thick roots entangle their feet. Norman's family are falling behind and realize too late that the encroaching trees are about to crush Norman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my goodness, look out!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perry! Do something! Perry is finding it difficult to move; a tree bears down on him, its roots snagging his thrashing limbs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm trying!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kick it in the knothole! Norman hops nimbly between two huge trunks as they SMASH together, blocking off the way ahead with gnarled wood. Sandra struggles free and shouts over the branches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norman?! ParaNorman 84.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: NORMAN (O.S.) I'm okay Mom! Wait for me here! Don't worry!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be careful! Now separated from the others, Norman turns to go ahead on his own. Ahead of him a phosphorescent glow shines off the trees, and he knows he is very close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . OLD FOREST CLEARING - CONTINUOUS Exhausted but determined, Norman finds the source of the supernatural storm; a clearing sculpted out of the forest by Aggie's fury. In the center of it all is the tree, bleached white as bone and grotesquely twisted. The trees around it CREAK and GROAN as though they'd like to uproot and plant themselves someplace else. Beneath this tree lie Aggie's remains, buried three hundred years ago. Now a mess of roots and rocks open out like an ugly wound, and within them a tiny childlike figure is barely visible through a spitting furnace of spectral energy. Ectoplasm rages up around the tree's finger-like branches like a mushroom cloud of negative energy. It's a child's tantrum turned atomic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? Words echo around him in response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not welcome here. Go away. Norman shivers as the voice RUMBLES coldly. The raging wind intensifies as Norman turns back around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh... I really need to speak with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm Norman. Norman Babcock. You don't actually know me, but I know you. We're actually kind of the same, you and I. Norman takes another step closer, ducking as petrified branches and rocks fly over his head on the wind. ParaNorman 85.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, no, apart from that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you're a boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, yes, that too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not like me at all. Norman hesitates, knowing he's on dangerous ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I know how you feel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No you don't. You don't know anything about me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know your name is Agatha Prenderghast. The ghostly voice wavers for the first time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I know you're probably tired. Right? Because, I mean, it's really late and it's been a long night and we're, like, only eleven years-old, and... The voice snaps back like a clap of thunder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to go to sleep, and you can't make me! I burnt the book into dust, and now I don't have to listen to that stupid story any more! Leave me alone! Norman is terrified, but advances on the tree, the rocks under his feet churning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I'm not leaving. Just listen to me. (takes a breath) Uh... once upon a time... long ago... there was a little girl... ParaNorman 86.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A little girl who was different from the other people in her village. The voice chants petulantly over him as if putting its demonic fingers in its ears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not listening! LA-LA-LA-LA-LA- LAAA!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She could see and do things that no one could understand, and that made them scared of her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't like this story!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turned away from everyone, and became sad and lonely, and had no one to turn to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop it! If Aggie weren't floating three feet above the ground, she'd be stamping her feet. Her voice blows bits of bark off the surrounding trees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But the more she turned away from people, the more scared they were of her, and they did something terrible! Arcs of white energy CRACKLE through the air. Where they hit the ground, they send up white flames.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They became so scared that they took her away and killed her!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But even though she was dead something in her came back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop! ParaNorman 87.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And this part of her wouldn't go away, not for three hundred years...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the longer it stayed, the less there was of the little girl!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll make you suffer!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why? Aggie goes to shout, but stops, unsure of her answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because... because...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because you want everyone to hurt just as much as you are! So whenever you wake up you play this mean game, but you don't play fair!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They hurt me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you hurt them back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanted everyone to see how rotten they were!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're just like them, Agatha.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No I'm not!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a bully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No I'm not! Norman has almost reached the eye of the storm. The world behind him is a whirling torrent of burning white chaos.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They did something awful, but that doesn't mean you should too! (MORE) ParaNorman 88.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All that's left of you now is mean and horrible! He sees her clearly now. True, she is floating above the ground, and her hair is writhing madly about her, and plumes of spectral fire are pouring off her body, but she's still just a little girl underneath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not true! Norman climbs up a tree root, Aggie's flames searing his skin and clothes as he gets close enough to touch her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then stop. This is wrong and you know it! You've spent so long remembering the bad people that you've forgotten the good ones. There must have been someone who loved you and cared for you. You don't remember them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave me alone!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you're not alone! You have to remember!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep away from me! Norman reaches the end of the root and jumps. His outstretched fingers shake madly as they approach Aggie's tiny hand, as though the air is fighting against him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remember! There is a flash of white, and silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NEW FOREST CLEARING - BRIGHT SUNNY DAY Dappled sunlight falls through shimmering leaves and blossoms. Norman and Aggie are standing in thick grass, replete with wild flowers, the dead white tree now quite alive and blossoming behind them. Aggie is no longer an indistinct specter, but flesh and blood and as real as Norman. She stares down at her hand as Norman holds it gently by the end of her finger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aggie. My name was Aggie. ParaNorman 89.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A brightly-colored butterfly flutters between them. Aggie starts to remember as she follows its flight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I... I remember my mommy brought me here once. We sat under the tree and she told me stories. They all had happy endings. (BROW FURROWS) And then those horrible men came and took me away and I never saw her again! She scowls angrily at the butterfly flitting past her face. It instantly crumples up into ashes. Surprised, she
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and watches the blackened dust fall to the ground. There's anger in Aggie, but there is confusion, sadness and regret there too. She isn't quite so scary anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometimes when people get scared they say and do terrible things. I think you got so scared, that you forgot who you are. But I don't think you're a witch. Not really. Aggie looks into his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you're just a little kid with a really special gift who only ever wanted people to understand her. He smiles softly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So we're not all that different at all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what about the people who hurt you? Don't you ever want to make them suffer? Norman thinks this over, and shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, yeah, but what good would that do? You think just because there's bad people out there that there's no good ones either? I thought the same thing. (MORE) ParaNorman 90.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For a while. But there's always someone out there for you. Somewhere. Aggie frowns, looking lost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just want my mommy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, Aggie. She's gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That story you were telling. How does it end?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think that's up to you. Aggie blinks through tears at the grass beneath her feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this where they buried me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a pretty good place to sleep. Then you can be with your mom again. Aggie holds Norman's gaze, then looks down to the ground, her tiny frame heaving with a last SOB. She sits down on the grass and curls up, resting her head on her hands. Norman kneels down next to her as she closes her eyes. Her breathing grows deeper and more peaceful; her tiny frame shifting softly under her long hair. The air around them grows blurry and indistinct. Aggie softens as though out of focus, and the whole world becomes a swirling dance of glowing orbs. Norman closes his eyes as a blizzard of light engulfs him, spiraling up into the clouds high above his head. Lightning flashes white far above and thunder RUMBLES softly through the sky, as if moving away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOWN HALL - CONTINUOUS The zombies form a group in the center of the square, all of them looking up into the clouds. The people around them stop and stare, awestruck as a breeze buffets their clothes and the air around them begins to shimmer. As the modern townsfolk watch on, some of the zombies take each others' arms for support. Those with eyelids close them. One by one their bodies dissolve away, leaving ethereal figures in their place. ParaNorman 91.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For a moment they float where they stood, ghostly apparitions of the people they once were before the curse. They stare sadly out at their flesh and blood descendents, and in an instant become just specks of light that are caught by the breeze and carried out of sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . OLD FOREST CLEARING - NIGHT Norman blinks open his eyes, taking a moment to survey the scene around him. He sits upon the upturned root of the tree, the earth around broken and twisted, a testament to what has happened. He looks up into the sky and gives a sad smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sleep tight. He clambers down through the roots back toward the path.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . OLD FOREST TRAIL - CONTINUOUS Norman wearily walks through the splintered roots to find his family. Sandra shouts out when she sees him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norman? Norman! Sandra runs over to him and scoops him up in her arms, hugging him tightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My brave little man! I thought I was going to lose you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom, you're embarrassing me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's my job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good job, Norman. Perry takes a deep breath and looks at his son. There is relief and a hint of admiration in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well done, Son. You did it. The Judge, stood some way behind them, lets out a GROAN, and the Babcocks turn to look at him. ParaNorman 92.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They watch in awe as the Judge begins to turn to dust, his ragged clothes and decayed body dissolving in the rain. For barely a moment a shimmering ghostly figure is left behind, an image of the man that once was. The spirit blinks sorrowful eyes, then becomes nothing more than a million glowing fragments dissipating on the breeze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NEW TOWN HALL - LATER The sky has lost its lurid pall, and the clouds are now lighter and less menacing. In the Town Square, clusters of townsfolk are trying to come to terms with the night's events. Norman weaves through the crowd away from the Babcock's station wagon, searching for Neil. He hears small snippets of conversation as he goes. Dwayne waves his notebook under Hooper's nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, uh, are we gonna need statements? She slaps it out of his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ow! That was my finger nail. Slob Guy, Crystal and Mrs Henscher are convincing each other of their excuses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what it's like. You join a mob and you say things. I was merely inhabiting the role.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, it was the others. They pushed me into it. Norman smiles as he passes Alvin, regaling a bunch of teenagers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, me and Norman are in a lot of the same classes. Pretty much inseparable. Best buds. And we do a lot of psychic investigations together. We have a blog actually, you should check it out. Nearby, Courtney wastes no time cozying up to Mitch. ParaNorman 93.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 146B COURTNEY So I was thinking, maybe we could catch a movie sometime? Nothing scary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That sounds great, Kathy! Y'know, you're gonna love my boyfriend! He's like a total chick-flick nut! Courtney stares at him, at a loss for words, then successfully reads between the lines and turns away
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Norman eventually finds Neil sat upon the witch statue's broken plinth, attempting to piece it back together pebble by pebble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Neil. He climbs up beside his friend, who beams at him gleefully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You did it! You stopped the witch's curse and made the zombies go away and saved pretty much everything!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess. I just wanted to say thanks. You stood by me. All the time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, of course. Don't get weird or anything. So you think now everything's gonna turn back to normal? Norman looks across the square. The smoldering buildings, the fallen signposts, the warped trees, the rubble...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As normal as it could be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BABCOCK'S HOUSE, LIVING ROOM - EVENING Norman sits on the floor in front of the TV. A news report shows the wrecked Main Street with the headline
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Perry enters the room, and Norman quickly changes the channel on the TV to a noisy monster movie. ParaNorman 94.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Son.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi Dad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What're you watching?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A scary movie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your, uh, your grandma here is she? Norman looks around and sees his father and grandmother sitting side by side on the sofa. He nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. Of course she is. Perry tries his best to maintain his composure, and wriggles a little in his seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is she... Is she sitting next to me? Norman nods. Perry "hem-hems" and turns awkwardly to face her, nose to ear. She doesn't seem to notice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi Mom. Perry tries to downplay his discomfort and turns back to concentrate on the movie his son is watching. Sandra and Courtney enter from the kitchen carrying snacks. Sandra takes a seat on an armchair and Courtney lies down on the floor beside her brother, munching popcorn. They all settle in to watch the movie. A beat, then Perry and Grandma speak at the same time.
direction.name: direction
